full_summary:
# Summative Feminist Learning Evaluation of the Women’s Voice and Leadership - Caribbean (WVL-Caribbean) Project
## Background
The Caribbean Regional Development Program (CRDP), NDE Americas Branch, within the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) requires the services of a contractor to conduct a summative evaluation of the Women's Voice and Leadership - Caribbean project. The evaluation will focus on assessing the project's effectiveness and impact, as well as providing recommendations for future learning and development.

## Evaluation Objectives
The evaluation will aim to:

* Develop evidence-based knowledge and forward-thinking reports and deliverables that draw on the perspectives and expertise of the grantees and other beneficiaries of the project.
* Assess the project's achievements and lessons learned, and identify areas for improvement.
* Provide recommendations for future learning and development, aligned with the project's objectives and the Department's strategic priorities.

## Scope of Work
The contractor will design and conduct the evaluation using a participatory feminist approach, in consultation with the grantees and the Technical Authority (TA), and the Evaluation Steering Committee. The evaluation will cover the project's implementation, achievements, and impact, as well as the lessons learned and areas for improvement.

## Evaluation Methodology
The evaluation will be conducted using a combination of qualitative and quantitative research methods, including stakeholder engagement, documentary analysis, and data collection and analysis.

## Tendering Procedure
This requirement is open only to those TSPS Supply Arrangement (SA) # E60ZT-18TSPS/XXX/ZT Holders who qualified under Tier 1 for services in the National Capital Region for the following Stream:

* Stream 2: Business Consulting/Change Management Team member
* Category:
	+ One (1) X Evaluation Services Consultant - Category (2.12) – Senior
	+ One (1) X Subject Matter Expert - Category (2.14) – Intermediate
	+ One (1) X Facilitator Consultant - Category (2.15) - Intermediate
